title.narrative: Magazine of Fair Trade and Development Policy (Maailmankauppalehti)

description.narrative: The project aims to produce four issues of a multicolour magazine which will cover areas located geographically far from city centers where most of the discussion and events concerning Third World countries take place. Each issue will be published in the I nternet as well. The magazine also functions as a message from Third World villages to the rural areas in our own country.One of our goals is to extend our readers' conspicuousness of the situation of the small handicraft and agricultural cooperative socie ties as well as other SMEs and people who are making their living in those. We cover especially practical working models that aim to improve people's living - and also different kinds of action we can do in our every day life to make a difference. Proper prices reasonable working conditions and long term contracts in commerce give them a better chance to provide for themselves and their families through their own work in their own country while cherishing their local traditions in handicrafts or livelihood .Maailmankauppalehti is the one and only specialized fair trade magazine in Finland. The magazine has been doing persistent information work concentrating in development politics and fair trade since 1984. It started as an organizational magazine but soon grew up to be a fair trade and development issues' magazine for everyone. The magazine follows global living on the grass root level through the eyes of individuals families and societies. It aims to increase Western citizens' and consumers' awareness of t he everyday life in the developing countries of the product chains and conditions as well as the possibilities of consumers to have an effect on the aforementioned issues.Maailmankauppalehti is not tied to any one of the fair trade labeling systems but is free to write impartially about all fair trade parties and labeling systems. The magazine is specially concentrated on that part of fair trade activism which is not covered by FLO the labeling organization that certifies mainly primary production and raw m aterials. Furthermore FLO already has a strong position through its local organization Fairtrade Finland.
